THE MICHIGAN COMMUNITY SERVICE COMMISSION (MCSC) WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES' ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY EVALUATION IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE; MAINTAIN THE AMERICORPS PARTNERSHIPS COORDINATOR STAFF POSITION TO HELP INCREASE COLLABORATION AND EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS; PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO PROGRAMS THROUGH A COMPLIANCE AND DATA SPECIALIST; AND PROVIDE LOCAL, STATE, AND REGIONAL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT/TRAINING EVENTS AND SERVICE PROJECTS TO MICHIGAN'S AMERICORPS PROGRAMS. THE MCSC IS REQUESTING $169,959 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO RE-OBLIGATE FUNDS FROM 21TA242957 PER THE REQUEST OF THE COMMISSION.  ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

SERVEWYOMING, THE WYOMING STATE SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: PROVIDE IN-PERSON AND ONLINE TRAINING FOR POTENTIAL GRANT APPLICANTS, DEVELOP STAFF AND SUBGRANTEE STAFF CAPACITY, THROUGH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TO ADMINISTRATE THE AMERICORPS GRANT IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE MISSION OF THEIR ORGANIZATION, PURCHASE AN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, INCLUDING TRAINING, AND PROVIDE LOCAL, STATE, OR REGIONAL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT/TRAINING EVENTS OR SERVICE PROJECTS FOR AMERICORPS MEMBERS. THE WYOMING COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $149,090 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

VOLUNTEER WEST VIRGINIA, THE STATE'S SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: 
*TRAINING AT THE AMERICORPS STATE AND NATIONAL GRANTEE SYMPOSIUM
*PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR AMERICORPS, VISTA AND SENIOR CORPS STAFF AT A CROSS STREAM TRAINING EVENT AND NONPROFIT LEADERSHIP SUMMIT
*CONSULTANTS FOR COMMISSION STAFF AND GRANTEES IN AUDIT PREPARATION, DIVERSITY EQUITY AND INCLUSION, RECRUITMENT AND BRANDING TRAINING,  AND TRAINING AND SUPPORT IN GRANT APPLICATION PREPARATION. 
*AND A SPECIAL OPIOID RESPONSE SERVICE PROJECT AS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE COMMISSION AND SENIOR CORPS DIRECTOR'S ASSOCIATION IN WEST VIRGINIA. 
THE WEST VIRGINIA COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $165,316 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

SERVE WISCONSIN, THE WISCONSIN SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: PRIORITY PERFORMANCE AREA #1: INCREASE NEW EVIDENCE BASED APPLICANTS TO COMPETITIVE AND FORMULA GRANT PROCESSES, INCLUDING A FOCUS ON RURAL AND UNDER-SERVICED AREAS OF THE STATE; PRIORITY PERFORMANCE AREA 3-STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES' ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND EVALUATIONS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE; AND PRIORITY PERFORMANCE AREA 4-PROMOTE A POSITIVE AMERICORPS MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND LIFE-LONG COMMITMENT TO SERVICE. THE WISCONSIN COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $169,096 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES

SERVE WASHINGTON, THE WASHINGTON SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: PRIORITY PERFORMANCE AREA #3: STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES? ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY EVALUATION IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE AND PRIORITY PERFORMANCE AREA #4: PROMOTE A POSITIVE AMERICORPS MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND LIFELONG COMMITMENT TO SERVICE. THE WASHINGTON COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $169,096 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

SERVERMONT, THE VERMONT SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES' ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND EVALUATION IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE THROUGH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, INCREASE AMERICORPS SERVICES IN RURAL AND UNDER-SERVED AREAS OF THE STATE THROUGH TRAINING, INCREASE COLLABORATION AND CROSS-STREAM PARTNERSHIPS THROUGH TRAINING EVENTS, PROMOTE A POSITIVE AMERICORPS MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND LIFELONG COMMITMENT TO SERVICE. THE VERMONT COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $149,090 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

2019 CIF EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE VIRGINIA SERVICE COMMISSION WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: (1)  WORK WITH ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO IDENTIFY WAYS TO EXPAND NATIONAL SERVICE IN VIRGINIA;  (2) IDENTIFY AND FACILITATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUBGRANTEE AND COMMISSION STAFF TO EXPAND AMERICORPS EXPERTISE; (3) PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUBGRANTEES TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF DATA COLLECTION PLANNING AND PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT ACHIEVEMENT AS STEPS IN PROGRAM IMPROVEMENT; (4) SUPPORT POSITIVE MEMBER EXPERIENCES AND ENCOURAGEMENT OF LIFE-LONG SERVICE; AND (5) INCREASE COLLABORATION AND CROSS STREAM PARTNERSHIPS.  THE VIRGINIA COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $169,096 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

USERVEUTAH, THE UTAH SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: IMPROVE COMMISSION CAPACITY TO DESIGN, DELIVER, AND MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT/TRAINING EVENTS, AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION AND CROSS STREAM PARTNERSHIPS. THE UTAH COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $169,096 TO SUPPORT THESE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

ONESTAR FOUNDATION, THE TEXAS SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: INCREASE NEW EVIDENCE-BASED APPLICANTS TO COMPETITIVE AND FORMULA GRANT PROCESSES, INCLUDING A FOCUS ON RURAL AND UNDER-SERVICED AREAS OF THE STATE, IMPROVE COMMISSION CAPACITY TO DESIGN, DELIVER, AND MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES' ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY EVALUATION IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE, INCREASE COLLABORATION AND CROSS-STREAM PARTNERSHIPS. THE TEXAS COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $189,102 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

VOLUNTEER TENNESSEE, THE TENNESSEE SERVICE COMMISSION, WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: INCREASE NEW EVIDENCE-BASED APPLICANTS TO COMPETITIVE AND FORMULA GRANT PROCESSES, INCLUDING A FOCUS ON RURAL AND UNDER-SERVICED AREAS OF THE STATE; STRENGTHEN SUBGRANTEES' ABILITY TO CONDUCT HIGH QUALITY PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND EVALUATION IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PROGRAMS AND BUILD EVIDENCE; PROMOTE A POSITIVE AMERICORPS MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND LIFE-LONG COMMITMENT TO SERVICE; AND INCREASE COLLABORATION AND CROSS-STREAM PARTNERSHIPS. THE TENNESSEE COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $169,096 TO SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES.

THE NORTH CAROLINA COMMISSION ON VOLUNTEERISM AND COMMUNITY SERVICE WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMISSION INVESTMENT FUNDS: 
1.	RECRUITING AMERICORPS PROGRAMS AND CONNECTING DISASTER SERVICES IN RURAL, DISASTER EFFECTED, OR UNDERSERVED AREAS OF THE STATE WITH IN-PERSON AND ONLINE TRAINING.
2.	INCREASE COLLABORATION AND CROSS-STREAM PARTNERSHIPS THROUGH COORDINATED LOCAL, STATE, OR REGIONAL TRAINING EVENTS, INVOLVING AT LEAST TWO TYPES OF SERVICE PROGRAMS AS WELL AS PROVIDING LOCAL, STATE, OR REGIONAL COMMISSION OR PROGRAM STAFF PEER EXCHANGES.
3.	STRENGTHENING SUBGRANTEES ABILITY TO RUN BETTER PROGRAMS AND SHOW THEIR PROGRAMS EFFECTIVENESS BY OFFERING TRAINING, MENTORING, AND USING COMMISSION CONSULTANTS TO IMPROVE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND EVALUATIONS.
4.	PROMOTE A POSITIVE AMERICORPS MEMBER EXPERIENCE AND LIFE-LONG COMMITMENT TO SERVICE VIA LOCAL, STATE, OR REGIONAL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT/TRAINING EVENTS INCORPORATING  AMERICORPS ALUMNI.
5.	IMPROVE COMMISSION CAPACITY TO DESIGN, DELIVER, AND MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVES BY INCREASING COMMISSION STAFF AND CONSULTANTS WHEN NEEDED TO ENSURE WE MEET THE MISSION TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.
6.	UPGRADE SYSTEMS FOR TRANSITION RECORD KEEPING, EFFICIENCY, ORGANIZATION SUCH THAT FUTURE COMMISSION STAFF AND THE COMMISSION PARTNERS ARE BETTER ABLE TO HANDLE DISASTERS, INCREASE VOLUNTEERISM AND EDUCATE COMMUNITIES ABOUT AMERICORPS PROGRAMS. 
7.	UPGRADE OR PURCHASE TECHNOLOGY AND TRAIN COMMISSION STAFF AND/OR SUBGRANTEES ON NEW TECHNOLOGY AND/OR DATA COLLECTION.
8.	IMPROVE STAFF SKILL SETS AND EXPERTISE OF COMMISSION STAFF THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING.
THE NORTH CAROLINA COMMISSION IS REQUESTING $165,316 TO EXPAND THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND RESOURCES OF THE COMMISSION BY SUPPORTING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES. THE NORTH CAROLINA COMMISSION DOES NOT INTEND TO APPLY TO HOST A REGIONAL NATIONAL SERVICE TRAINING CONFERENCE IN 2019.
